title.narrative: We are able! Sudan

description.narrative: By 2025, through engagement with public authorities (formal and informal powerholders), men, women and youth with disabilities and other excluded groups, through resilient and capable local CSOs/DPOs in this fragile and conflict-affected country, are successfully influencing laws, policies, practices and norms for improved food security for all.

The We are able! program targets people (including women, men, and youth) with a disability, while, as spin-off, the program will also create opportunities for other excluded groups,3 such as vulnerable women, persons affected by leprosy, youth in general, excluded ethnic groups, internally displaced persons (IDPs) and refugees, as much as possible or necessary in the specific context. Intersectional traits often make people particularly vulnerable. Refugees with disabilities or disabled women and men of particular ethnic backgrounds often face the most severe forms of food insecurity. We are able! identifies and targets groups and individuals with particular vulnerabilities while creating synergies that allow others to benefit as well.

The activities in Sudan are part of the We are able! program in DR Congo, Burundi, Ethiopia, South Sudan, Sudan and Uganda. Food security in these countries is low. People with disabilities (PWDs) are even more likely to live in food insecure households. We are able! wants to see PWDs improving their right to food and food security by creating an enabling environment for right-to-food action at grassroots level. While PWDs are the core target group of the We are able! program, we create benefits for other excluded groups like vulnerable women, youth in general, marginalised ethnic groups and internally displaced persons (IDPs), as applicable per context.

title.narrative: SCS4 # of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency
# of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency

comment.narrative: 1) Khartoum: The Union of the Deaf: Through advocacy in 2016 four deaf teachers were appointed in the ministry of education after they passed their interview using sign language. 2) Khartoum: The Union of the Deaf: The Union has created strong support for their cause: the realization of the “ALAMAL Institute” including legal support from different institutions like ALNAS and the Ministry of justice. A media campaign was coordinated with most television channels and radio stations, and there was a daily report and addition to the Union page on Facebook, as well as some members holding meetings with government officials. 3) Gedaref: Steering Committee: They engaged with the Ministry of Youth and Sports, Ministry of Information, Family Planning Organisation, Weber Organisation, Youth Peer Education Organisation and Friends of Peace and Development Organisation through training and educational workshops, meetings, discussion groups and media platforms to promote inclusiveness of persons with disabilities in sports. 4) Khartoum: The Union of the Blind: Since five years there is an annual cultural and social forum being held by the union, where all the blind from one of the states of Sudan are invited to mobilize the efforts of the states and there is always a cultural, social and sports programme, and this contributes greatly to the process of integration into communities. 5) Khartoum: The Union of the Blind: The Union has a cultural and media office and fixed activities including radio sessions with blind broadcasters dedicated to programs for persons with disabilities. In addition to social networking sites, the Union also has a YouTube channel broadcasting all activities related to persons with disabilities. 6) Khartoum: the Intellectual Disabilities Union: During the international days the UNION raises awareness of communities about groups of persons with disabilities. There is the International Day of Autism, the day for Down Syndrome, and the International Day of Disability. These days are to bring the community together and raise community awareness about groups of persons with disabilities. The focus is on the need for training and rehabilitation so that persons with disabilities can participate and contribute to the advancement of society. 7) Khartoum: The Union of the Blind: They have partnered with the traffic police and they educate the traffic police about the white cane, to help implement the white cane regulations. They collaborated on the International Day of Awareness of the White cane, and it became part of the traffic laws.

title.narrative: # of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency at sub-national level

comment.narrative: 1) Khartoum: The Union of the Deaf: Training of doctors, midwifes and nurses in medical sign language. We have an agreement to create a medical dictionary in sign language -2020. 2) Gedaref: Steering Committee: There were students with disabilities who were denied access to universities on the basis of lack of “medical fitness”. The General Union of Persons with Disabilities was addressed through the sub-federations of persons with disabilities, which in turn addressed the university administration. A meeting was set that includes the union, the university administration and professors advocating for the issues of persons with disabilities to solve the problem and it has already been resolved. 3) Gedaref: General Union of the Disabled / Productivity is coming: They talked about accessibility for persons with disabilities to public facilities and offices, and in light of this, the entrances have been modified to accommodate persons with disabilities. T 4) Gedaref: General Union of the Disabled / Productivity is coming: Through education sessions organized by the Union persons with disabilities were educated about their rights. 5) Gedaref: Cooperative for persons with disabilities: Through training and workshops targeted at the Hospital administration and the Ministry of Health, they lobbied for accessibility of the Gedaref hospital including bathrooms for persons with disabilities. 6) Gedaref: Cooperative for persons with disabilities: Together with a group of activists and similar associations, they were able to create an advocacy network to lobby for inclusive education and fight for the right to education of university students with disabilities who were rejected on the grounds of lack of “medical fitness”. 7 ) Gedaref: Cooperative for persons with disabilities: With their advocacy network they addressed the devaluating terminology used when referring to persons with disabilities They addressed media and families of persons with disabilities. 8) Gedaref Cross Disability Federation Steering Committee: Seminars were held to raise awareness of the rights of persons with disabilities and the need for their integration into society. 9) Khartoum: the General Union of People with Mobility Disabilities: The Union has organized cultural activities to let the community know that disability does not prevent a person from being active, influential and affective. 10) Gedaref: Maan: Increase awareness through workshops and training on the right to education and health care and the need to develop and adapt educational and health related buildings to the needs of persons with disabilities so that they can access these services. 11) Gedaref: Maan: Through dialogue sessions with community leaders and families discuss and promote the issue of inclusiveness of persons with disability.

title.narrative: SCS3 # of times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSO demands and positions through agenda setting, influencing the debate and/or creating space to engage Methodological notes
# of times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSO demands and positions through agenda setting, influencing the debate and/or creating space to engage at sub-national level

comment.narrative: 1) Khartoum: Union of the Deaf: The Union has contributed to the employment of persons with disabilities within a company called DAL. In fact the company has a whole department of persons with disabilities. This initiative has been copied by another company called SIGA which has recruited female staff with disabilities. 2) Gedarif Cross Disability Federation Steering Committee A group of the torch initiative1 was delegated and an interview was held with the Governor of Gedaref in which the Governor was requested to include representatives of persons with disabilities in decision making processes that concern them. At the same time a group of workshops and marches were organized to educate persons with disabilities on their rights. 3) Gedarif Cross Disability Federation Steering Committee The Committee advocated for the equal treatment and respect in society. They tried to change negative attitudes towards persons with disabilities by demonstrating their capabilities. Among others they demonstrated this by having a blind person inserting a thread into a sewing needle and having another person with disabilities write.

title.narrative: # of times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSO demands and positions through agenda setting, influencing the debate and/or creating space to engage at national and international level

comment.narrative: 1) Khartoum: the Union of the Blind: The Union has demanded the state to oblige private sector companies and investors to sponsor some persons with disabilities or to open job opportunities for them as part of their social responsibility. 2) Khartoum: the Union of the Blind: The Union is supporting several blind lawyers who have been refused official documents to practice as lawyers because the state thinks that they do not meet the conditions. The Union is negotiating for the lawyers to be legally recognized. 3) Khartoum: the Union of the Blind They have asked the traffic police to include the white cane mark in the driving license exam. It has been approved and is currently being studied as part of the driving curriculum. 4) Khartoum: the Intellectual Disability Union: Through workshops and meetings with partner Unions and relevant ministries, laws and policies are discussed which need amendments. Through lobbying the State is now obliged to work with the 2017 law because it was designed to match the international law for persons with disabilities. 5) Gedaref Steering Committee The Ministry of Health and Social Care was addressed and informed of the need to involve persons with hearing impairments in the process of raising health awareness among citizens, with the justification that some citizens only understand sign language. 6) Gedaref Steering Committee The Department of Zakat and Localities was addressed by the sub-federations of Persons with Disabilities with the request of involving persons with disabilities in the base committees to ensure their needs and interests are taken into account. This has been granted. 7) Gedaref Maan: Maan conducted workshops and training including media and government departments to adopt the terminology used and preferred by persons with disabilities.

title.narrative: SCS2 # of laws, policies blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development as a result of CSO engagement.
# of governmental policies blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development as a result of CSO engagement

comment.narrative: Gedaref: Agricultural Cooperative for Persons with disabilities 2) They pleaded with the Ministry of Education to change policies, and indeed the right to inclusion was guaranteed.

title.narrative: # of laws blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development as a result of CSO engagement

comment.narrative: Khartoum: Union of the Blind 1) A team of engineers has been formed to create a building code for persons with disabilities. This code has been passed, and a binding law has been enacted by the Ministry of Urban Planning and Infrastructure, in addition to amending the old buildings to suit persons with disabilities. 2) In the year 2017 the Union contributed to the amendment of a law related to raising the employment rate of persons with disabilities in the civil service from 2% to 5%. Gedaref: Agricultural Cooperative for Persons with disabilities The Law on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities did not take into account many aspects of the rights of persons with disabilities. The Cooperative worked in groups with legal experts and beneficiaries, made amendments and sent them to Khartoum. Gedarif Cross Disability Federation Steering Committee Some articles have been amended of the Persons with Disabilities Law of 2017. Voluntary committees were formed including jurists and the law was revised and some articles were added to better reflect and serve the conditions of persons with disabilities in the state after reviewing the national and state law, and they were added in the Persons with Disabilities Law 2017 Amendment of 2020. Khartoum: the General Union of People with Mobility Disabilities The Union addressed the Ministry of Urban Planning, and discussed the need to amend the building code. The law was amended to ensure access to persons with disabilities to these buildings and improve accessibility and usability of the buildings by persons with disabilities . This building code was approved by the Engineering Council and the Council of Ministers. The code is applied in Khartoum state, but it is applied also in other states.

title.narrative: # of by-laws blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development as a result of CSO engagement

comment.narrative: Khartoum: Union of the Deaf The UNION has contributed to the removal of the requirement for medical fitness as a condition for acceptance in vocational training centres. Khartoum: the General Union of People with Mobility Disabilities In the year 2016 the General Union presented working papers to the Legislative Council of Khartoum State, which led to an increase in the employment rate for persons with disabilities from 2% to 5% in the Civil Service Khartoum: The intellectual Disability Union Children with learning difficulties used to be examined with the rest of the students, and when they do not succeed they drop out of school. The UNION has pleaded with the examinations committee in the Ministry and presented them with a proposal to develop a special curriculum and examinations of children with learning disabilities. This has been adopted in some states. Gedaref Steering Committee The Committee managed to prevent a raise in prosthetic fees by 300% for persons with mobility impairments in the year 2016. Again recently they intervened when the fee was going to be raised by 400%. They managed to plea for a raise of 150% only.

title.narrative: # of international agreements blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development as a result of CSO engagement

comment.narrative: No cases of blocked, adopted or improved international agreements were found

title.narrative: # of private sector company policies blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development as a result of CSO engagement

comment.narrative: No cases of blocked, adopted or improved private sector company policies were found.
